definition: Toutiao, personalized content recommendation app (abbr. for 今日頭條|今日头条[Jin1 ri4 Tou2 tiao2])
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: The act made headlines in China at the time.
sentences.chinese: 這項義舉在當時成了中國新聞頭條。

sentences.english: I did it once, and all the headlines came off on my white pants. On the level!
sentences.chinese: 我做過一次，所有的頭條消息都印在我的白褲子上。

sentences.english: The headline in our Grand Rapids Press wasn't good news.
sentences.chinese: 今天，《大湍市快報》的頭條並非好消息。

sentences.english: This maiden voyage of Titanic must make headlines.
sentences.chinese: 泰坦尼克號的處女航必須成爲頭版頭條。

sentences.english: It was headline news in Greece.
Avoid defacing headliner inside the vehicle .
sentences.chinese: 避免污損頭條新聞車內。

sentences.english: The debutante's photograph was at the head of the society page.
sentences.chinese: 那位初進社交界的少女的照片登在社會版的頭條。

sentences.english: McKinsey, which usually contorts itself to stay out of the news, became a headline regular.
sentences.chinese: 一向遠離新聞焦點的麥肯錫成爲頭條常客。

sentences.english: Nowadays the bird flu has been the frontpage news all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 現在全世界禽流感成了頭條新聞。

sentences.english: Greece will move back into the headlines, since the country will need another cash infusion.
sentences.chinese: 希臘又會成爲頭條，因爲該國又需要現金輸液。

sentences.english: "It also appeared on the front in an inset", Price said.
sentences.chinese: “該故事同樣也出現插頁的頭條，”帕瑞斯說。

sentences.english: But the latest headlines to mention her name have not been nearly as flattering.
sentences.chinese: 但是，最近有關她的新聞頭條卻遠非溜鬚拍馬。

sentences.english: When was the last time you remember Randt making a news headline?
sentences.chinese: 你還記得雷德最後一次成爲新聞頭條是什麼時候嗎？

sentences.english: The headlined unemployment rate is just over 10 percent.
sentences.chinese: 報章頭條的失業率已高過10個百分點。

sentences.english: Nestling amongst the many headlines was one relating to our own Roman Abramovich!
sentences.chinese: 在很多頭條新聞中有一條是關於我們的老大阿布的。

sentences.english: When Roger was finally arrested, it was big news in Arkansas.
sentences.chinese: 羅傑最終還是被逮捕了，這在阿肯色州是頭條新聞。

definition: dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
regular column or segment (in a publication or broadcast program)/program (TV or radio)
to gallop/to assist/to attack/to wade/great/old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]
to interview (a particular person or on a particular topic)/special interview/special report based on such an interview
